revised_title: Magnetism in Copper and Other Substances During Rotation
tldr: The author, Samuel Hunter Christie, conducted experiments to study the magnetism developed in copper and other substances during rotation. He discovered that rapid rotation of a copper disk caused it to develop magnetism when placed near bar magnets. The strength of the magnetism appeared to depend on the distance between the magnets and the disk. This research contributed to the understanding of electromagnetism and the relationship between rotation and magnetism in materials.
